title: 820-01987-A 2020 A2289
message:
Hi, I was to preface by saying I do not know how these newer boards work.

I had a cap that blew and I replaced it on this board, I do not have the schematics so I can not say specifically. I have attached a picture of the cap though.

Connecting this board to a USB-C meter it successfully goes to 20V, drawing about 20mA -> to about 150mA for a second -> to 450-500mA for a brief moment -> 350mA for slightly longer then back to 20mA.

I do not know if is actually working properly, the cpu does turn on during the 450-500mA phase, I do not have a whole computer to properly test it.

Do you think it is functional?

title: 820-01987-A 2020 A2289
message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jQm6hpWVPsn0oBCpLr-xvD_g9td_gLq0/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
No boardview available.

If the board gets stuck in 20mA, is not working properly.

Test the board alone on the desk, disconnecting LCD, trackpad, etc.
Check for USB activity.

title: 820-01987-A 2020 A2289
message: I literally only have the board, that's why I was asking. Thank you for the schematics.
